title: Packaging Operator (3rd Shift)
description:
Want to make your voice heard? As a Packaging Operator, you’ll have the freedom to help improve how we manage our production operations. **You'll be working in our Liquids Department on 3rd shift with a schedule** of **Monday-Friday from 11:15pm- 7:30am**. Training on 1st or 2nd shift prior may be required.

**Packaging Operator**  
**Hillsborough, NJ**  
**Competitive Salary & excellent benefits package**

**DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Follows all applicable Safety Rules and policies including Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), HAZCOM, Process Safety, Lock Out/Tag Out and Emergency Action.
* Assist Packaging Tech with all supporting functions with operating the production line including:
* Housekeeping: Follows all applicable waste, scrap reduction and recycling guidelines.
* Component Traceability
* Clear out basic jams on the production line & restart the machine
* Feed production line with material, as necessary.
* Complete monthly Behavioral Safety Observations.
* Operate aerial lift, as necessary. (in house certification required)
* Follows current work instruction and insures adherence to the Quality Control Plan and related Standard Operating Procedures (SOP).
* Trains new Operators and Temporary Workers as needed.
* Works effectively in a team-based work environment.
* Complete case packer, case sealer and posimat changeovers.
* Assist Packaging Tech with preventative maintenance.

**SKILLS & ABILITIES**

* Minimum 2+ years’ experience in a manufacturing environment.
* Must have a high school degree or GED equivalent.
* Demonstrated ability to operate a Packaging Line and related equipment including startup, clearing jams, manual operations and shutdown.
* Demonstrated ability to assist in changeovers, wash outs and preventative maintenance.
* Demonstrated ability to perform minor troubleshooting and adjustments to maximize run time.
* Demonstrated ability to use computers for data entry and reporting purposes.
* Must have strong communication skills and command of the English language, both verbal and written.
* Able and willing to work overtime, when the business needs additional support

**Equality**

**All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, disability or medical condition; color, ethnicity, race, citizenship, and national origin; religion; pregnancy, family status and caring responsibilities; sexual orientation; sex, gender identity, gender expression, and transgender identity; protected veteran status; size or any other basis protected by appropriate law.**

* Monday to Friday

title: EHS Specialist
description:
**EHS professional who will provide EHS support and technical expertise to the Raynham MA and Bridgewater NJ Client facilities.**

**Travel Required: Yes**

* Requires up to 5% domestic travel, including frequent travel to Bridgewater,NJ and Raynham MA

**Duties:**

* The Senior EHS Specialist, under general supervision, will plan, lead, and implement Safety programs to achieve Client goals and strategies.
* They are responsible for establishing and maintaining robust processes that identify, evaluate, and control Safety risk in the workplace.
* This role partners with various business groups in Operations, R&D, and Office to provide technical mentorship and implement continuous improvement initiatives.
* They conduct comprehensive assessments and data analysis to establish strategies and inspire change to meet Client, franchise, and site goals.
* They will ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulations, as well as Client EHS Standards.
* They will also participate on diverse, high-caliber, multi-functional teams to provide solutions for Safety issues.
* Demonstrate ability to apply current knowledge of applicable local and government safety regulations (e.g., OSHA, etc.) and reporting requirements.
* Connect with site business leaders regarding safety compliance policies, site practices, and issues.
* Coordinate site teams and committees to develop and implement specific Safety practices and procedures (i.e., incident response team, EHS champion team, laboratory safety committee, EHS site inspections).
* Provide Safety technical support through the Management of Change process for new facility construction, equipment purchases, and new product development projects.
* Plan and deploy the electronic work permit (ePTW) project with key stakeholders for October 2024 launch.
* Implement the contractor safety program and permit to work program to evaluate risk and establish high value controls.
* Develop and deliver technical training and safety awareness programs in support of company's hazard/risk profile.
* Conduct annual program reviews, identify deficiencies, develop, and lead implementation of management action plans, and monitor progress.
* Perform internal audits of safety compliance.

**Qualifications**

* Minimum Bachelor's degree required; advanced degree or focused degree in Safety or Industrial Hygiene, Engineering, or other equivalent science field or subject area preferred
* Certifications preferred: CSP, CIH, and/or CHMM

**Required:**

**Minimum four (4) years of relevant work experience**

* Safety and Industrial Hygiene experience, including identifying, evaluating, and controlling risks in the workplace.
* Technical/working knowledge of federal, state, and local EHS regulations.
* Demonstrated project leadership skills, with the ability to lead projects and produce and maintain project schedules/budgets.
* Excellent planning, influencing, organizational, and time management skills.
* Excellent interpersonal skills, as well as effective written and verbal communication skills
* Proficiency in MS Office Suite, including demonstrated ability to generate presentations, spreadsheets, graphs, and reports.

**Preferred:**

* Experience working with EHS data reporting and tracking systems
* Technical experience in diverse Safety and Industrial Hygiene areas including but not limited to contractor safety, ergonomics, electrical safety, machine safety, or biosafety
* Experience within a fast-paced manufacturing/production environment
* Volume or unit measure of job duties:) Computer work up to 6 hrs. per day. Walking and standing up to 4 hours per day.

**Equipment usage and abilities needed:**

* Familiar with Industrial Hygiene equipment including Noise dosimeters, Sampling Pumps, Computers and Databases

**Conditions & Physical Demands of Job**

* Requires ability to meet the physical demands, including periods of standing, production floor/facility mobility, and lifting up to 25 lbs
* Wear personal protective equipment including: Safety Glasses, Safety Shoes and Hearing Protection.

title: Full-time Medical Assistant
description:
At **Doral Health & Wellness**, we are proud of our commitment to the Brooklyn, New York Community to provide integrated interdisciplinary health services in an innovative medical facility dedicated to the health and well-being of our patients.

We are seeking a **Medical Assistant** to join our supportive and encouraging team!

**Responsibilities:**

* Helps patients by providing information, services, and assistance.
* Maintains medical supplies inventory and performs preventive maintenance to keep medical equipment operating by following operating instructions, troubleshooting breakdowns, maintaining supplies, performing preventive maintenance, and calling for repairs.
* Verifies patient information by interviewing patients, recording medical history, and confirming the purpose of the visit.
* Prepares patients for examination by performing preliminary physical tests; taking blood pressure, weight, and temperature; and reporting patient history summary.
* Saves doctors’ time by helping with office procedures.
* Secures patient information and maintains patient confidence by completing and safeguarding medical records; completing diagnostic coding and procedure coding; and keeping patient information confidential.
* Counsel patients by transmitting physician’s orders and questions about surgery.
* Schedules surgeries by making arrangements with the surgical center; verifying times with patients; and preparing charts and pre-admission and consent forms.
* Maintains a safe, secure, and healthy work environment by establishing and following standards and procedures and complying with legal regulations.
* Keep supplies ready by monitoring inventory stock, placing orders, and verifying receipts.
* Keeps up to date with industry best practice
* Serves and protects the practice by adhering to professional standards; facility policies and procedures; and federal, state, and local requirements.

**Qualifications:**

* Medical Assistant Certification
* 2-3 years of experience in a medical office
* Experience with EMR (electronic medical records), medical terminology
* Excellent verbal & written communication skills.
* Bilingual in Spanish preferred.

**Compensation:**

* Pay rate is $23-$24 per hour depending on experience
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Holiday Pay
* Dental insurance
* 401(k)
* Vision insurance
* Life insurance
* Disability insurance
* Other

title: STEM Instructor - Manhattan [teaching certificate NOT required]
description:
**TITLE: STEM Teacher (Afterschool)**

**PURPOSE OF JOB**: Under the direction of the Executive Director, this position is responsible for facilitating lessons within STEM afterschool and/or out-of-school-time programs in assigned  
NYC schools and community-based organizations. This position is also responsible for collaborating with other STEM Kids NYC STEM teachers in promoting interdisciplinary STEM activities into the company’s core curriculum.

You’d be teaching during the **Afterschool** timeframe (Monday-Friday, 2:00pm-5:30pm), and you would teach based upon your availability. Y**ou may also be teaching during the school day,** as some of our school sites want to integrate STEM into their students' school day.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**  
1. Deliver STEM-oriented instruction through project-based learning methods. Based upon your proficiency, you would be delivering instruction in Computer Science, or Engineering,  
Science, Robotics, or Creative Tech (MakerSpace, AI, AR/VR) to K-12 students.

2. Attends professional development and training related to STEM programs and methodologies, staying abreast of current research.

3. Employs a variety of instructional techniques, instructional media, and performance assessments, which guide the learning process toward curriculum goals and student learning.

4. Uses technology to promote learning, creativity, and collaboration.

5. Works occasionally with school administrators and staff in the development, implementation, and evaluation of STEM initiatives and curriculum.

6. Organizes, develops, and coordinates special STEM events/activities.

8. May serve as liaison to prospective or selected STEM vendors, to determine the best resources, options and innovations that will optimize the learning experience for students and staff.

9. May be called upon to initiate new programs that support the STEM vision.

10. Shares STEM events and activities through social media, such as Facebook, Twitter and  
Instagram.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**  
Masters in Mathematics and/or Science and/or a STEM preferred or related field. Bachelor of  
Science Degree and/or demonstrated experience in teaching in a classroom environment required.

1. Experience in delivering professional development to teachers.  
2. Evidence of at least three (3) years of exemplary classroom teaching experience - traditional class or informal learning spaces.  
3. Excellent communication skills.  
4. A proven track record in the use of a rich array of instructional methods, the analysis and use of data and technology to improve instruction, and the ability to build professional relationships, solve problems, and plan collaboratively.  
5. Evidence of productive experience with problem-based learning.  
6. Evidence of planning, organization, and time management skills that will bring structure and accountability to the position.  
7. Proven ability to apply computer science, science and/or math content knowledge, formative assessment,and technology integration at a high level.  
8. Deep understanding of student learning theory, brain-based learning, and differentiated instruction.  
9. Deep understanding of NET-S, NGSS, CCSS and PBL.  
10. Proven ability to collaborate with teachers regarding student learning.  
11. Desire to continue learning “what works” in classroom instruction.  
12. Familiarity with culturally relevant and culturally responsive teaching strategies.

**COMPANY INFO: https://stemkidsnyc.org/**

title: Parts Manager
description:
**What is a Commercial Parts Pro?**

Professional level sales position capable of supporting advanced functions on the commercial side of the business. Position is responsible for profitable growth of the commercial business via customer retention and growth. Position partners with GM to manage team members. The role has expert knowledge of automotive system and part knowledge. The role has the ability to source from numerous places including special order, FDO, second source, etc. The role has the ability to direct the drivers to ensure timely and accurate delivery. Position is full time.  
**Primary Responsibilities**

* Maintain commercial customer relationships
* Provide GAS3 selling experience commercial customers
* Achieve personal / store sales goals and service objectives
* Provide day-to-day supervisory support for team members
* Collaborate with GM on coaching and developmental needs for team members
* Dispatch drivers ensuring delivery standards are achieved
* Maintain commercial stocking programs
* Build and maintain a network of second source suppliers

**Secondary Responsibilities**

* Maintain core bank and commercial returns
* Maintain commercial credit accounts
* Partner with GM to ensure proper driver coverage

**Success Factors**

* Friendly communication
* Ability to locate and stock parts
* Safety knowledge and skills
* Operating inventory systems and store equipment
* Parts and automotive system knowledge skills
* Operating POS and Parts lookup systems
* ASE P2 certified or ASE ready equivalent
* Advanced solution, project and product quality recommendation ability
* Ability to source from numerous places including special order, FDO, second source, etc.
* Advanced selling skills for commercial customers
* Ability to multi-task and remain organized
* Effective communication, listening and problem solving skills

**Essential Job Skills Necessary for Success as a Commercial Parts Pro**

* Working knowledge of automotive systems, and diagnostic ability to include: internal engine, suspension, brakes, electronic, exhaust, etc.
* Speak and write English (Spanish a plus); communicate effectively and build strong relationships with customers, peers and management
* Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, parts catalogs, and procedure manuals; ability to write simple correspondence
* Understand and execute instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form
* Successfully complete the Parts Knowledge Assessment
* Use basic math accurately: add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals
* Use Microsoft software effectively (Word, Excel required)
* Strong organizational skills
* Understand Commercial profitability concepts, including knowledge of competition, market opportunities, and customer prioritization (may work with the Commercial Account Manager to determine pricing discounts for specific Commercial customers)
* Ability to work an assortment of days, evenings, and weekends as needed

**Prior Experience that Sets a Commercial Parts Pro up for Success**   
A minimum of 3 years of prior automotive parts experience preferred

Proven sales ability with past experience in fulfillment of customer transactions

Formal or informal experience leading teams, including supervising daily tasks, and working together to achieve goals

**Education**  
High school diploma or general education degree (GED)  
**Certificates, Licenses, Registrations**  
ASE certification preferred, but not required  
**Physical Demands**   
The physical demands and work environment described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job, with or without reasonable accommodation. While performing the duties of this job, the employee will predominantly be walking or standing. The employee is required to be able to talk and hear, and use hands and fingers to handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.  
**Work Environment**  
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job, with or without reasonable accommodation. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is usually working inside; however, they will occasionally be outside and exposed to various weather conditions while performing such tasks as installing batteries and wiper blades. The employee is also occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts; high, precarious places; toxic or caustic chemicals; risk of electrical shock; explosives; and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

title: School Counselor
description:
**School Counselor**

**The School Counselor plays a vital role in supporting students social emotional and academic well being by preparing them for the middle school experience, academic excellence, high school application process and otherwise supporting and developing them to take advantage of future opportunities.**

**Responsibilities**

**Counseling Duties**

* **Develop and support the high school placement process**
* **Support in the transfer process**
* **Plan and execute a full-service mentoring program**
* **Support the advisory program by developing lessons**
* **Provide intervention and counseling for students and build students' ability to meet the school’s high expectations**
* **Provide one-on-one counseling or group counseling as needed to students and families**
* **Identify students and family members who may benefit from regular one-on-one counseling or group counseling**
* **Conduct regular needs-assessments of current student and family needs**
* **Identify external resources and services and referring them appropriately**
* **Administer records, documentation, and other compliance activities**
* **Collaborate with teachers and admin**
* **Uses data to ensure accuracy of attendance records, including verification of forgeries and truancies and/or signing students in/out for the purpose of complying with State laws governing attendance accounting.**
* **Communicates with parents, students, staff, etc. in person, by telephone, letter and/or home visits for the purpose of providing information on a variety of attendance issues and meeting district and state absence notification requirements.**
* **Assesses student and family needs and makes referrals to appropriate school resource personnel, educational options, social agencies, community agencies, alternative programs, outside psychologists and other mental health resources with an appropriate follow-up process.**
* **Intervenes during crisis situations, participates on school crisis team and helps students process their problems and concerns around academic, emotional, attendance or social problems and plan goals and actionable next steps**
* **Assists with communication for outside scholarships agencies and partnerships**
* **Assists teachers in understanding their students, including providing and interpreting student data**
* **Presents attendance and social emotional information about students in weekly Behavior and Grade Level meetings**
* **Screens telephone calls for the purpose of directing to appropriate personnel and/or taking messages**
* **Performs enrollment and un-enrollment with activities, enrichment and clubs with school programs**
* **Uses the majority of the time (80%) to provide direct services to students through preventive and responsive services, including individual student planning, and uses the remaining time in development and management, system support and accountability**
* **Responsibilities to be fulfilled consistently across grades levels (6, 7, 8) students, parents and staff**
* **Able to travel between 3 campuses and conduct home visits**
* **Support with new student enrollment**

\\*  
Other Duties

* Any and all other responsibilities as delegated and assigned by the Board of Trustees and the Principal

\\*

title: One-to-One Direct Support Professional - A Career With Meaning
description:
**The Nicholas Center - Revolutionizing The Way Autistic Adults Learn, Live & Work!** 

**The Nicholas Center** is an innovative organization offering meaningful opportunities within an exciting, supportive workplace environment.

Work at the #1 Nonprofit on Long Island!

**Job Summary:** We are seeking a compassionate and dedicated individual to join the Nicholas Center in Port Washington as a **One-to-One Direct Support Professional** for an adult with autism. As a one on one support professional, you will be responsible for providing personalized assistance to an individual with autism in their daily life. Your role will involve implementing and monitoring individualized plans, promoting independence, and helping the individual achieve their goals.

**For more about what makes The Nicholas Center a great place to work, visit our website at:** https://tncnewyork.org/join-our-team

**Positions Available:** **One-to-One Direct Support Professional (DSP)**

**Schedule:** Monday - Friday 9AM to 4PM \\*Ideal, flexible schedule for a parent/caregiver or someone who needs/wants to work another job!

**Benefits for One-to-One Direct Support Professional (DSP):**

* Medical insurance
* Paid Time Off and federal holidays
* Paid family leave
* Short/long term disability
* Employee assistance program
* Online training and professional development
* Bonuses for exemplary annual performance

**Job Duties & Responsibilties for One-to-One Direct Support Professional (DSP):**

* Provide one-to-one support to an adult with autism in the community, and workplace.
* Implement individualized plans designed to meet the specific needs of the individual, as directed by the supervising clinician.
* Help the individual develop social and communication skills, as well as daily living skills such as self-care, and social, emotional, and vocational skills.
* Assist the individual in participating in recreational activities that align with their interests and preferences.
* Monitor and document the individual's progress and report any changes or concerns to the supervising clinician.
* Maintain a safe and clean environment for the individual, ensuring their physical and emotional well-being.
* Work collaboratively with other members of the support team.
* Attend training and development sessions to improve knowledge and skills related to autism and direct support.
* Be prompt, organized and respectful to your co-workers, the people you support and the members of the community.
* Adhere to the Organizational Core Values - People, Professionalism, Community, Innovation, Integrity (training provided).
* Adhere to the organization’s Code of Ethics and perform your duties satisfactory as outlined in the Core Competencies (training provided).
* Complete all required training and maintain confidentiality.

**Minimum Job Qualifications for One-to-One Specialist (DSP):**

* 18 years of age or older
* High School completion is required.
* Must be able to bend and lift items 30 lbs or less.
* Must be able to multi-task and stand for the majority of the day.
* Clean and valid driver’s license and no infractions that preclude a person from working with members of a vulnerable population.

**Experience:** Experience required.

**License:** Driver's License - Required.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $17.00 - $19.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* No weekends

Application Question(s):

* Please list 2-3 dates and time ranges that you could do a 30 minute, virtual interview.

Ability to Commute:

* Port Washington, NY 11050 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Lead - 1st Shift
description:
**Logistics at full potential.**

  

At GXO, we’re constantly looking for talented individuals at all levels who can deliver the caliber of service our company requires. You know that a positive work environment creates happy employees, which boosts productivity and dedication. On our team, you’ll have the support to excel at work and the resources to build a career you can be proud of.

  

1st Shift, Monday - Friday, 7:00am - 3:30pm

  

Our employees are our greatest asset! We’re always on the lookout for inspirational leaders who know how to get the best out of their team. As the Lead, you will oversee your assigned team and area in the warehouse to ensure our operations continue to run smoothly. Become a part of GXO, and you’ll have a starring role in helping us provide exceptional daily solutions for our customers.

  



**Pay, benefits and more.**


The hourly pay rate for this is $21.50. GXO, in good faith, believes this is the pay rate for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted rate and this rate is only applicable for jobs to be performed in New Jersey. This rate may be modified in the future. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401(k), and other benefits to eligible employees. You can apply for this role by clicking on the *Apply now* button at the bottom of this posting (or through the Employee Job Hub if you are a current GXO employee). Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company’s sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

  



**What you’ll do on a typical day:**

* Oversee operational processes to ensure correct inventory levels are maintained and orders are completed accurately and on time
* Review workload and assign tasks to employees
* Properly train and coach the warehouse team and provide positive developmental opportunities; recommend performance improvement actions as needed
* Correctly utilize warehouse management system and maintain appropriate work documents
* Establish, maintain and promote exceptional customer service
* Correctly interpret and enforce company policies and safety procedures to ensure compliance
* Safely operate various equipment and tools
* Provide support and backup to warehouse management
* Track orders and investigate problems
* Catalog and track goods and/or supplies
* Adhere to the 7S program by maintaining a clean environment
* Work in a safe manner that protects you and your team members

**What you need to succeed at GXO:**

At a minimum, you’ll need:


* 2 years of experience in a warehouse environment
* 1 year of SAP experience
* Experience with Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) and handheld scanners

It’d be great if you also have:


* High school diploma or equivalent
* Availability to work a flexible schedule as needed, including planned and unplanned overtime, which may include weekends
* 1 year of experience as a supervisor
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
* Skills in inventory control and cycle counting


This job requires the ability to:


* Lift up to 50 lbs. frequently and greater than 75 lbs. occasionally
* Take a reach truck or cherry picker to a height of 23+ feet
* Tolerate hot or cold warehouse environments

**We engineer faster, smarter, leaner supply chains.**

  

GXO is a leading provider of cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team – energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make GXO a great place to work.

  

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran or other protected status.

  

GXO adheres to CDC, OSHA and state and local requirements regarding COVID safety. All employees and visitors are expected to comply with GXO policies which are in place to safeguard our employees and customers.

  

All applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment may be required to take and pass a pre-employment drug test.

  

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed. Review GXO's candidate privacy statement here.

title: Medical Receptionist
description:
Job Summary:  
Join our team at South Shore Family Medical as a Medical Receptionist, where you will play a crucial role in providing exceptional patient service and administrative support.

We are seeking a detail-oriented individual with experience in medical office management, front desk operations, and patient service at our office locations in Valley Stream, Inwood , Long Beach, Baldwin and Arverne offices.

Responsibilities include:

- rooming patients

- updating EMR charts

- running lab equipment

- performing lab tests

- EKG's, preparing charts

- Checking in/out patients

- insurance eligibility  
- Answer incoming calls and greet patients in a professional and courteous manner.  
- Schedule patient appointments and manage the appointment calendar efficiently.  
- Verify patient information, insurance details, and assist in completing necessary forms.  
- Maintain electronic health records accurately and ensure compliance with coding and HIPAA regulations.  
- Assist in care plans coordination and communicate effectively with healthcare providers.  
- Handle administrative tasks such as filing, data entry, and managing patient inquiries.  
- Collaborate with the medical team to facilitate patient flow and provide excellent customer service.  
- Manage the front desk area, including check-in, check-out procedures, and addressing patient queries promptly.

Experience Preferred: (willing to train the right candidate)  
- Proven experience in a medical receptionist role or similar position.  
- Familiarity with Meditech or similar electronic health record systems is preferred.  
- Knowledge of hospital procedures, terminology, and patient service protocols.  
- Ability to type accurately and efficiently.  
- Understanding of HIPAA regulations and maintaining patient confidentiality.

Must be responsible, organized and reliable. No restrictions Mon-Fri.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $16.00 - $18.86 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Medical Specialty:

* Primary Care

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)
* Medical terminology: 1 year (Preferred)
* Computer skills: 1 year (Preferred)

title: Landscape Designer
description:
**About Yost Design**  
With an emphasis on the evolving relationships between house and yard, Yost Design focuses on customizing landscapes to every project, person, and use. title: Part-time Security Officer
description:
Position Description

Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory (CSHL), Department of Security is seeking a motivated, dependable, and trustworthy security professional to join its team as a Security Officer (Part-Time - No Benefits, Available to work day, evening, and midnight tours of duty to include weekends and holidays as needed).

The Security Officer (unarmed) position ensures a safe and secure workplace environment for employees, students, residents, guests, and visitors at all CSHL properties. The position requires the operation of security vehicles and the enforcement of CSHL security policies.

Position Responsibilities

* Patrol and monitor buildings and grounds to protect life and property and to prevent fire, thefts, vandalism, illegal entry, and unlawful/unauthorized activity.
* Respond to security/facility system alarms and emergency situations (fire, medical, police, utility, civil disorder, and intruder); to include serving as the on-scene CSHL liaison with local first responders.
* Enforce security policy, secure doors, locks, etc., and activate or de-activate alarms, as required.
* Control and regulate pedestrian and vehicular traffic in a safe, orderly, and respectful manner, as required.
* Operate and maintain security vehicles in accordance with regulatory compliance and policies.
* Operate and maintain all security and facility equipment in accordance with facility guidelines and/or security policies.
* Write comprehensive incident reports and maintain daily activity logs in accordance with CSHL policies and procedures to document events.
* Report all fire and safety hazards and issue parking violations; escort CSHL employees, students, residents, and guests after business hours, as required.
* Assist Department of Security personnel in the performance of their duties, as required.
* Perform other security-related duties and tasks as assigned by the Director of Security and/or the Assistant Director of Security.

Position Requirements

Education: High School Diploma or Equivalent  
Experience: 2+ years serving in a private security professional role or present/former law enforcement officer.

Current license to practice as a Security Guard in New York State and/or active duty New York State police officer.  
Valid Driver’s License  
Valid certification in Basic Life Support (CPR/AED) and First Aid by the American Red Cross

Supplemental Information

For immediate consideration, please apply for this position with cover letter & resume on the CSHL careers website at:

Security Officer | Job Details tab | Career Pages (schooljobs.com)

**We strongly recommend to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19; however, it is not a requirement for employment.**

**Hourly rate: $23.00**

Founded in 1890, CSHL has helped shape contemporary biomedical research and education with today’s research endeavors encompassing cancer, neuroscience, plant biology and quantitative biology. CSHL is a private, not-for-profit institution in New York and has been home to eight Nobel Prize winners. Today, CSHL’s multidisciplinary scientific community is bolstered by more than 600 researchers and its Scientific Meetings & Courses Program, which hosts more than 9,000 scientists from around the world each year on its campus. For more information about CSHL, please visit us at www.cshl.edu  
CSHL is an EO/AA Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status. VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $23.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Holidays
* Monday to Friday
* Night shift
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Lab Accessioner / day shift
description:
**Accessioners** are our front line in the laboratory. They are indispensable participants at the entry point of specimen testing. Their ability work quickly to identify, label and troubleshoot samples ensures minimal disruption to our high-volume specimen testing processes. The Accessioner unpacks, labels and sorts incoming laboratory specimens. The Accessioner performs basic data entry of patient demographics and test information. The laboratory Accessioner is responsible for sorting and distribution of blood and body fluid specimens to designated departments for analysis.

**Shift is: Sunday – Thursday 8am-4:30pm**

**OR Tuesday – Saturday noon – 8:30pm** 

Duties & Responsibilities:

· Receives specimens from multiple daily deliveries. Properly accession multiple types of specimens including blood, urine, swabs, CSF, synovial fluid, biopsies etc.

· Review, transcribe, and enter demographic and specimen data into the laboratory information system with 100% accuracy.

· Match information on the test requisition with information on the collection vial for accuracy.

· Documents specimen quality issues; takes appropriate action to ensure proper specimen handling, accept and reject specimens based on laboratory standard operating procedures.

· Communicates specimen issues to shift supervisor or designee. Issues can include: compromised specimens, insufficient specimen quantity, inappropriate sample type and mislabeled specimens.

· Receives, verifies, prioritizes and facilitates the delivery of patient specimens and information to the designated laboratory departments or locations.

· Facilitate requested changes from clients or other staff personnel.

· Prepare specimen work lists as needed for tracking purposes.

· Handle hazardous waste management activities in accordance to preset policies, protocols, and regulatory standards.

· Assists with other data entry and clerical functions.

· Ensure proper completion of all work during assigned shift.

· Performs other duties as assigned.

Requirements:

Education:

· High School Diploma or equivalent, required.

Experience:

· Prior clinical laboratory experience, preferred.

· Knowledge of laboratory accessioning protocol, preferred.

Skills:

· To receive, sort, pour off and distribute specimens requires visual acuity and manual dexterity.

· Promotes positive co-worker relationships, teamwork and cooperation, both within the department and across departmental lines. Works collaboratively and is respectful of others.

· Must consistently demonstrate high level of attention to detail and focus.

· Able to perform multiple tasks simultaneously.

Physical Requirements:

· Position requires extensive sitting, extensive sitting and routine walking.

· Ability to push/pull up to 35lbs and lift objects of up to 25lbs is occasionally required.

· Some laboratory tests performed are dependent on color determination. Ability to differentiate colors is required to perform these tests.

· Category I risk exposure as defined by OSHA.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $17.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Paid sick time

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Night shift
* Overtime

Experience:

* Laboratory Accessioning: 1 year (Preferred)

Language:

* English (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Hotel Maintenance/ Janitor / House Attendant
description:
The newly renovated Holiday Inn Westbury Hotel is looking for a highly motivated Maintenance / House Attendant / Janitor. A candidate that can support and represent this amazing team. That can assist our guests promptly, warmly, efficiently, and courteously in all hotel-related functions while projecting high standards of service and professionalism at all times. We pride ourselves on providing our guests with exceptional customer service.

We currently have a career opportunity available for a Hotel Maintenance Janitor/Porter that can work evening shifts, weekends & holidays.

**Responsibilities** include, but are not limited to, the following:

· The Maintenance Engineer conducts a daily walk-through and visually assesses the safe and efficient maintenance of physical structure(s) of the hotel, all mechanical, other hotel systems and related equipment and the guest rooms.

· Replace non-operating TV's and phones in the hotel rooms and other equipment as necessary

· Replace light bulbs throughout the facility

· Perform scheduled preventive maintenance

· Notify supervisor on duty in the event of equipment or system failure

· Repair minor plumbing or other system problems as requested

· Diagnose lock problems and repair/replace the unit

· Troubleshooting HVAC unit, change filters, empty and clean lines and pans, test thermostats, reset units

· Troubleshooting toilets, faucets and shower plumbing

· Responding to guest request and concerns in a courteous and professional manner

· Maintains a consistent, regular attendance record.

· Executes guest, management and owners request.

· Assists with all maintenance and preventative maintenance to include: heating, plumbing, preventative maintenance, front and back of house spaces, A/C units, ice machines, lighting, roof exhausts, etc.

· Ensures all projects are completed according to specifications and are completed on time.

· Performs maintenance checks of equipment and logs properly.

· Reports all safety and security concerns to the Director of Engineering, General Manager or the Manager on Duty immediately.

· Responds to all emergency situations and prepared to assist.

· Participates in ongoing maintenance programs for event space, public space, guest rooms and restaurant.

· Performs inventory duties as required.

· Ensures cleanliness and orderliness of all work space and storage areas.

· Complete projects as determined by the Director of Engineering.

**Requirements:**

· Previous hotel/resort experience is a plus

· Must have basic knowledge of carpentry repairs and maintenance.

· Furniture repair experience preferred.

· Excellent interpersonal skills; this is a guest contact position.

· Physical requirements include, but are not limited to: climbing ladders, standing or sitting for extended periods, reaching, lifting, moving heavy objects, using hands/arms/legs to get into small areas to repair equipment

· Willing and able to work evening, weekends and holidays.

Please send your resume or drop off your resume at the Holiday Inn Westbury

title: Executive Assistant
description:
**About Us:** Cotronics is a leading manufacturing and distribution company of high temp adhesives, based in the vibrant borough of Brooklyn, New York. With a commitment to innovation, quality, and excellence, we have established ourselves as a key player in the industry. We are seeking a dynamic and highly organized Executive Assistant to support the President.

**Position: Executive Assistant**

Responsibilities:

**Administrative Support:**

* Manage the President's calendar, schedule appointments, and coordinate meetings.
* Maintain and update itineraries for internal meetings.
* Screen and prioritize incoming emails, calls, and correspondence.
* Prepare and edit documents, reports, and presentations as needed.
* Prepare (or assist with) meeting agendas, attend meetings and record minutes.
* Ensure the President is well-prepared for all meetings with necessary notes/materials/information.
* Follow up on action items resulting from meetings.

**Communication and Coordination:**

* Act as a liaison between the President and internal team members and selected external vendors and/or clients.
* Coordinate and organize special projects as directed by the President.
* Prepare correspondence to internal team and to outside clients/vendors as needed and directed.
* Keep the President organized by proactively staying ahead of (and anticipating) what is coming due (projects/meetings/etc.).

**Information Management:**

* Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.
* Organize and maintain electronic and hardcopy files for the President.
* Conduct research and compile data to assist the President with projects that require detailed analysis.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration or related field preferred.
* Proven experience as an executive assistant or similar role.
* Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant software.
* Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.
* Detail-oriented and able to work independently with minimal supervision.
* Prior experience working in an administrative role in a manufacturing company, a plus.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary
* Health insurance
* Retirement savings plan
* Professional development opportunities
* Collaborative and inclusive work environment

If you are a proactive and detail-oriented individual with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of Cotronics. Please submit your resume and cover letter to HR@cotronics.com.

Cotronics is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

* Brooklyn, NY 11232 (Preferred)

To learn more about the Waldorf School of Garden City, we encourage you to visit our website at www.waldorfgarden.org.

title: UGG Seasonal Sales Associate
description:
Job Description

**About UGG**

At UGG, a division Deckers Brands, we exist to transform the lives of our customers and each other by sharing our passion and love for UGG. We’re driven by a clear mission: to bring the UGG brand to life through every interaction and evolve industry ideas by delivering experiences our customers desire. As a member of the Deckers Family, you represent our brands and deliver unique, personalized shopping experiences.

**Summary**

Our Sales Associates are critical to the success of our stores. As a Sales Associate, it’s your job to create the best possible customer experience. It’s your job to listen to each customer and offer recommendations and current product knowledge in response to their needs. You also know how to communicate the UGG brand’s sustainability initiatives and social and ethical commitments to our customers while sharing your love and passion for our products. As a Sales Associate, you operate as part of dynamic team and you cooperate to achieve business goals.

**Description**

As an UGG Sales Associate, you create personalized shopping experiences for our customers that drive brand loyalty. You understand the importance our modeling our Service Training Program and you greet customers promptly and courteously as they enter the store. You ensure that all customer questions are addressed accurately and responded to before they leave. You provide exceptional service from start to finish, including effectively communicating our return policy. You maintain a positive, cheerful attitude with customers and team members and promote the store and brand image in all interactions including adhering to a dress code. You provide exceptional customer service to both our in-store customers and those who call on the phone.

In your role as a Sales Associate, you understand that your role extends beyond the sales floor. You know how to operate the cash register, handle money accurately, check inventory daily and ensure products are stocked and available for customers, and merchandize product in accordance with Visual Merchandising standards. You also maintain a clean and well-organized back-stock area and employee break area, which includes daily vacuuming, sweeping, and dusting. You practice safety-consciousness and respond to theft in accordance with our policies. As an UGG Sales Associate you understand that you are an integral part of a team; you report to work on time and notify your Store Manager in advance if you will be late or absent.

**Core Competencies**

As a successful Sales Associate, you know how to:

* Ensure the highest level of customer service possible as outlined in our Service Training Program
* Prioritize brand and product knowledge training in customer interactions
* Communicate effectively with customers, team members, management, and corporate stakeholders
* Contribute to a team and cooperate to achieve goals
* Multi-task in a fast-paced environment
* Respond to problem situations with professionalism
* Think critically to solve problems and approach challenges with agility

**Key Qualifications**

* Two (2) years of retail store experience preferred.
* High School Diploma
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to convey the UGG and Deckers Brands Vision and Mission to your team members and customers
* Highly motivated team player and self-starter

**Additional Requirements**

* Flexibility of schedule and hours to meet the needs of the business.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of tools and applications.
* Valid driver’s license.

As part of our UGG Family, you belong to more than a lifestyle company. From our corporate offices to our retail stores across the globe, we value giving people the freedom to pursue their passions, express their individuality, and are committed to helping them succeed. We’re proud to offer a wide range of benefits to best recognize the important role each person plays in the Deckers Brands mission. You’ll discover many benefits of working at Deckers Brands including competitive pay, discounts, perks, global contests, as well as opportunities for growth and development.

**Equal Employment Opportunity** 

**All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other factors prohibited by law.**

Job Types: Part-time, Seasonal

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift
* Night shift

Work Location: In person

* Strong planning and tracking skills, customer focused, well organized, detail oriented and capable of successfully managing multiple projects.
* Excellent time, priority, and self-management skills. Strong project management skills.
* Strong team orientation: demonstrates initiative to solve problems and improve efficiency and/or customer service.
* High degree of proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Word. Microsoft Project, Veeva preferred.

title: Registered Nurse (RN) - ICU
description:
Job Description



Performs an age specific plan of care for a designated group of patients using the nursing process of assessment, diagnosis, outcome identification, planning, implementation, and evaluation of patient care. Collaborates with physicians and other health team members in coordinating and implementing procedures and treatments. Uses leadership skills/clinical judgment in coordinating patient care and directing/delegating activities of the patient care unit team.



Job Responsibility





* Conducts patient interview, explains policies and procedures to patient/ significant others, reviews patient’s chart and answers questions correctly and courteously; assesses gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, respiratory, renal and neurological health status; determines mobility, sensory deficits, prostheses use, and skin condition and adjusts plan of care, as appropriate; assesses level of pain and pain management; communicates/documents patient’s physiologic health status and plan of care; assesses patient’s psychosocial health status; elicits perception of medical/nursing care and the expectation of care.
* Determines coping mechanism, knowledge level, and ability to comprehend; identifies cultural/ethnic requirements to reduce anxiety and ensure patient satisfaction; communicates and documents psychological status and care plan of support groups, counseling services, and social services; identifies patient outcome; develops criteria for measurement of patient outcomes; identifies actual/potential patient problems; identifies patient’s need for teaching based on psychosocial and developmental assessment.
* Develops patient outcome statement (s) and establishes individualized patient goals; identifies care activities and establishes the priorities necessary to achieve expected outcome; coordinates the cost-effective use of supplies, equipment and medication to achieve expected outcome; documents the plan of care and collaborates with physicians and other health team members; implements the plan of care; maintains constant vigilance over patients care to ensure that safety precautions/needs are followed (side rails up, call lights and bedside stand within reach, etc.).
* Exercises professional skills related to the plan of care; reassesses patients as needed and appropriately revises plan of care; correctly administers prescribed treatments; correctly uses equipment necessary for patient care; provides emotional support to patient and significant other; applies scientific principles in performing procedures; carries them out safely, timely and efficiently; makes accurate observations of patient’s conditions during treatments/procedures; reports and records same as appropriate; Keeps accurate documentation of patient’s treatment, activity and condition, as well as patient’s responses to medical and nursing interventions; uses appropriate methods of documentation according to departmental policy; acts rapidly and effectively during any emergency situation, managing self, patients and other employees; provides a calm, quiet, restful atmosphere; communicates effectively with the patient’s family or caretakers; participates in planning for discharge and coordinates referrals, as appropriate; provides discharge instructions to patient and significant other; evaluates care provided for patient outcome.
* Demonstrates ability to measure effectiveness of care provided and documents same; performs variance analysis related to outcome data for performance improvement; designs, implements, and evaluates systems to improve care in unit; keeps accurate documentation of patient’s treatment, activity and condition; uses appropriate methods of documentation according to departmental policy; collaborates with other care team members in planning and carrying out treatment regimen; provides direction to other members of the care team; collaborates with the appropriate physician on patient’s plan of care.
* Accurately interprets and implements treatment regimen as prescribed by the Physician; assists the Physician during treatments and/or diagnostic procedures; keeps the Patient Care Manager/designee and/or physician, abreast of changes in patient’s condition and/or treatments, as appropriate; uses clinical judgment in delegating assignments in providing patient care, and ensures that assignments are completed in a timely fashion; performs grade I-IV Decubitus Care; performs preventive skin care measures; applies simple dressings, maintaining principles of aseptic technique.
* Applies warm and cold compresses, consistent with facility procedure; performs irrigations, consistent with Facility procedure; performs other procedures related to skin care, as necessary; administers medications correctly and safely; correctly identifies medication in terms of action, dosage, side effects, and implications for the patient; meets standard on medication administration examination; demonstrates preparation of local solutions.
* Administers and documents medication correctly; educates patients and significant others related to drug and food interactions; educates patients and significant others related to drug and food interactions; participates in patient and family education; provides patient with an explanation of his/her condition as indicated; communicates assessment data in an orderly fashion by recording, updating and verbalizing pertinent information to care team members and to appropriate agencies; recognizes and utilizes health teaching opportunities and resources /materials available for this teaching; provides for early discharge planning and appropriate referrals for post-hospital care; evaluates the effectiveness of teaching by feedback from patient/ family and documents same.
* Performs related duties as required. All responsibilities noted here are considered essential functions of the job under the Americans with Disabilities Act. Duties not mentioned here, but considered related are not essential functions.


Job Qualification





* Graduate from an accredited School of Nursing. Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing, preferred. Must be enrolled in an accredited BSN program within two (2) years and obtain a BSN Degree within five (5) years of job entry date.
* Current License to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse in New York State required, plus specialized certifications as needed.
* 1-3 years critical care experience required.

  

  

* **Additional Salary Detail**


The salary range and/or hourly rate listed is a good faith determination of potential base compensation that may be offered to a successful applicant for this position at the time of this job advertisement and may be modified in the future.When determining a team member's base salary and/or rate, several factors may be considered as applicable (e.g., location, specialty, service line, years of relevant experience, education, credentials, negotiated contracts, budget and internal equity).

title: GME Training Program Administrator
description:
Job Description



Implements program objectives maintaining databases, recruiting residents, and promoting effective working relationships with faculty and fellows. Responsible for assisting the development of program policies, procedures and system processes that are compliant with external guidelines.



Job Responsibility





* Assists maintaining program accreditation with ACGME and applicable councils; prepares and coordinates materials and resources for ACGME self-study and site visit reviews.
* Assists in reviewing, assessing, developing, implementing and enforcing program-specific policies as required by the ACGME and other accrediting bodies; maintains, monitors and completes all required updates on applicable websites, surveys and electronic databases.
* Provides administrative and logistical coordination of all aspects of medical education programming in the department; prepares, monitors and disseminates faculty and resident rotations, on-call coverage, work hours and vacation schedules.
* Coordinates annual appointment, credentialing and on-boarding process for existing and new residents and fellows to ensure effective navigation of on-boarding process.
* Plans and executes annual residency and/or fellowship recruitment processes, documentation and events.
* Monitors and coordinates evaluation process to ensure ACGME milestone evaluations are captured.
* Assists with completion of Annual Program Evaluation (APE) module and ensures submission to OAA.
* Organizes and oversees all aspects of courses, conferences, alumni and graduation events; ensures that applicable events align with established CME guidelines.
* Compiles all required documents to ensure Clinical Competence Committee (CCC) functions to program requirements and standards of the Next Accreditation System.
* Operates under general guidance and work assignments are varied and require interpretation and independent decisions on course of action.
* Performs related duties as required. All responsibilities noted here are considered essential functions of the job under the Americans with Disabilities Act. Duties not mentioned here, but considered related are not essential functions.


Job Qualification





* Bachelor's Degree required, or equivalent combination of education and related experience.

title: Client Service Associate**
description:
Client Service Associate\\*\\*

Job Number:

 3257545


POSTING DATE: Aug 15, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
JOB: Wealth Management
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Non-Exempt

DESCRIPTION


POSITION SUMMARY

Client Service Associates provide exceptional service to our clients and support Financial Advisor(s) (FAs)/ Private Wealth Advisor(s) (PWAs)/ teams on a daily basis. Through regular interactions with clients, individuals in this role build trusted relationships. Leading with a client first mindset, a successful candidate for this role will have strong interpersonal skills and will be able to assist clients with their everyday needs.


DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:

CLIENT SUPPORT

Provide service coverage for a FA/PWA/team including:
Supporting the FA/PWA/team in cultivating and enhancing new and existing client relationships
Executing money movement transactions at the request of the client and/or FA/PWA
Answering general non-investment related questions concerning client accounts, including relaying stock positions and providing account balances (e.g., funds due and margin debit)
Enter profile information or pre-fill account documentation on client accounts and/or documents in a clerical capacity at the direction of the client and/or FA/PWA
Educating or enrolling clients in digital tools (e.g. MSOnline, eSign, eAuthorization)

title: Category Manager, Gifts
description:
We are seeking an experienced, highly creative, innovative, strategic **Category Manager/Sr. Manager** to join our team. As a key member of our Product Development team, you will be responsible for conceptualizing and commercializing products from concept to launch for our Specialty Gifts category. This role requires strong creative intuition, analytical skills, market knowledge, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.





**Responsibilities:**


* Creative: Conceptualize and design new products that align with brand and market needs
* Prototypes & Testing: Create prototypes and test product designs for functionality and feasibility.
* Assortment Development: Analyze market data, consumer trends, and sales performance to determine optimal product assortment. Collaborate with vendors and internal teams to ensure a well-balanced assortment that meets customer needs and drives sales growth.
* Vendor Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers and negotiate favorable pricing. Continuously evaluate vendor performance and make recommendations for improvement or alternative suppliers as necessary.
* Market Analysis: Stay up to date on industry trends while identifying emerging trends, consumer preferences, and competitive landscape. Leverage insights to develop strong products that are innovative and competitive.
* Timeline: Manage and develop the product development timeline to ensure critical milestones are met throughout the product development lifecycle.
* Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with various teams, including merchandising, planning, merchandising operations, vendor relations and sourcing to align category strategies with overall business goals. Provide guidance and support to cross-functional teams to ensure successful execution of initiatives.
* Team Leadership: Manage, guide, and mentor Assistant Manager fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement.

Requirements:
* Bachelor's degree BS, fashion merchandising, home product management
* 6+ years of experience with a successful track record in developing and commercializing new products. Preferably in the gifting, floral, or consumer packaged goods (CPG) ecommerce sector.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with attention to detail and a focus on delivering high-quality products.
* Excellent project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
* Thrives in a fast-paced, results- driven, entrepreneurial environment
* Motivated self-starter and successful project manager


**Preferred Skills and Qualifications**


* Proficiency in using CAD software.
* Familiarity with intellectual property rights and patent processes.


The expected salary range for this position is $80,000-$100,000. The actual compensation will be determined by experience and other factors permitted by the law.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
**Join SportProsUSA: Where Dreams Become Reality**

**Our Vision**  
Imagine a world where every sports enthusiast or child has access to high-quality, personalized sports environments that enhance their skills and enjoyment. At SportProsUSA, we are creating that world, one court at a time.

**Your Team and Mission**  
You’ll be part of a passionate team dedicated to revolutionizing sports construction. Our mission is to deliver exceptional sports environments that leave a lasting impact on our clients and their communities. Your role will help us achieve this mission and drive us towards a future where everyone has the perfect place to play.

**Our Culture**  
We work hard, play hard, and celebrate our wins together. Our culture thrives on collaboration, innovation, and a relentless pursuit of excellence. We believe in making a positive impact through every project we undertake.

**Are You Ready?**  
Only continue if you’re shouting "HELL YEAH!" because this role will challenge you, push your limits, and offer immense rewards.

**Role Summary**  
As an Administrative Assistant, you will be the backbone of our office operations, ensuring smooth workflows, exceptional customer service, and effective support for our sales team. You will be pivotal in maintaining our high standards and helping us achieve our mission of delivering world-class sports environments.

**Mission Impact**  
This role is crucial for creating positive experiences for our clients and ensuring the efficiency of our internal processes, directly contributing to our mission of excellence in sports construction.

**What You Will Love Doing**

* Answering phones and providing stellar customer support.
* Mastering the knowledge of our products and services.

* You are **Detail-Oriented**: Precision is your middle name.
* You are **Dependable**: Always reliable and can be counted on.
* You are **Proactive**: Take initiative and anticipate needs.
* You are **Friendly**: You create a welcoming environment for everyone.
* You are **Professional**: Always maintain a high standard of professionalism.
* You are **Adaptable**: Thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
* You are **Persistent**: Never give up until the job is done.
* You are **Efficient**: Maximize productivity and minimize waste.
* You are **Personable**: Connect with clients and team members alike.
* You are **Motivated**: Driven to achieve and exceed goals.
* You are **Thorough**: Ensure every task is completed with meticulous accuracy.
* You are a **Team Player**: Collaborate effectively and support your colleagues.

Are you ready to join us and make a difference?

title: Per Diem Athletic Trainer
description:
**Job Summary**:

We are seeking a dedicated and knowledgeable Per Diem Athletic Trainer to join our team. In this role, you will provide on-call coverage and services to athletes and active individuals in various settings. You will be responsible for preventing, assessing, and treating athletic injuries, as well as promoting injury prevention strategies. This position requires flexibility in scheduling and the ability to work on short notice, often during peak athletic seasons or special events.

**Key Responsibilities**:

* ***Injury Prevention and Assessment***: Provide guidance on proper conditioning, stretching, and exercise routines to prevent injuries. Evaluate, diagnose, and treat musculoskeletal injuries.
* ***Rehabilitation***: Develop and implement individualized rehabilitation programs to help athletes recover from injuries and safely return to their activities.
* ***Emergency Care***: Respond to acute sports injuries during events or practice sessions, including providing first aid, stabilization, and making referrals to appropriate healthcare providers.
* ***Collaboration***: Work closely with coaches, physicians, and other healthcare professionals to ensure comprehensive care and appropriate injury management.
* ***Education***: Educate athletes, patients, and coaches on injury prevention, safe training practices, and health and wellness.
* ***Coverage***: Provide athletic training services on an as-needed basis during games, practices, tournaments, and other events.

**Qualifications**:

* ***Education***: Bachelor’s degree in Athletic Training or related field (Master’s preferred).
* ***Certification***: Certification by the Board of Certification (BOC) for Athletic Trainers required.
* ***Licensure***: Active New Jersey State Licensure as an Athletic Trainer.
* ***Experience***: Minimum of 1-2 years of experience working as a certified athletic trainer preferred.
* ***Skills***: Strong knowledge of sports medicine, injury prevention, and rehabilitation techniques. Ability to make quick decisions in high-stress environments.
* ***Communication***: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with athletes, coaches, and healthcare professionals.

**Physical Requirements**:

* Ability to stand for long periods, kneel, bend, and lift up to 50 lbs.
* Ability to work outdoors and in varying weather conditions during events and practices.

**Hours**:

This is a per diem position requiring availability for evening, weekend, and potentially holiday coverage, depending on event scheduling. Flexibility and the ability to work on short notice are key.

**Compensation**:

Competitive hourly rate based on experience.

Pay: $25.00 - $35.00 per hour

Medical Specialty:

* Sports Medicine

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

License/Certification:

* CPR Certification (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Ringwood, NJ (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Ringwood, NJ: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

description:

Shift: 1st shift  



This is a full-time position within our manufacturing facility with opportunities for advancement!

  

**Who we are!**  

Schwan's Company, a U.S. affiliate of the global lifestyle company CJ CheilJedang Corporation, is a leading U.S. manufacturer and marketer of quality foods offered through retail-grocery and food-service channels. Its many popular brands include Red Baron®, Tony's®, Big Daddy's™, Villa Prima®, and Freschetta® pizza; Mrs. Smith's® and Edwards® desserts; Bibigo®, and Pagoda® Asian-style snacks. To learn more about Schwan's, visit www.schwanscompany.com.  

**What we want to do for you:**



We offer eligible employees competitive pay and comprehensive benefits package designed to assist employees and their families with their financial security, health, and well-being.


* Health, Life, Dental, and Vision Plans
* Earn up to 2 weeks paid time off during first year
* 401k with Company Match

  


**What we are looking for:**  

Here at Schwan's Company, we put a high priority on having safe, clean, and healthy workspaces. And we want individuals that take that seriously.


* Candidates with a high school diploma or equivalent, 0-1 years of experience preferred, must be 18 years of age
* This job is in a fast-paced environment and will require you to be physically active
* Operate machines safely with minimal supervision
* Lift up to 50 lbs. - bending, carrying, pushing, pulling and other activities as needed

The employing subsidiaries of Schwan's Company are Equal Employment Opportunity Employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, age, race, color, religion, gender, vet status, national origin, or other protected classes.

title: Supervisor for Medical Assistants - Bilingual Spanish
description:
**Job Summary:**

Responsible for leadership role in providing safe, structured, environment that meets the needs of the Unaccompanied Children (UC's) while always maintaining professional and acceptable boundaries. Responsible for the actions of all Medical Assistant/Youth Specialists and their daily interactions with the children. Ensures a safe and therapeutic environment as well adherence to the rules and policies set forth by the Federal Office of Refugee Resettlement (ORR).

**About Abbott House:**

Abbott House is an innovative community-based organization that helps children, families, adults and people with intellectual and developmental disabilities with complex needs build lasting foundations for a promising future. We operate programs in the New York Metropolitan area and Hudson Valley.

**Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Provides supervision to Medical Assistants/Youth Specialists including training of new staff.
* Conducts regular individual and group supervisor sessions.
* Documents all personnel issues in conjunction with agency policy.
* Monitors and ensures that the Medication log is appropriately completed by staff.
* Checks Medication Cabinet daily – removing expired medication or medication for children who are discharged.
* Meets 2x a week with Medical Coordinators to review the medication lists, and request medication for any child in process of discharge.
* Attends weekly Staffing and presents medical issues and progress of any assigned child.
* Works in collaboration with all Units supervisors to assure supervisor coverage is 24/7.
* Monitors maintenance needs of unit and ensures timely maintenance requests.
* Monitors cleanliness and appearance of unit and ensures proper supplies.
* Attends all mandatory trainings.
* Assures there is a medical assistant for any child requiring one to one.
* Works closely with Senior Supervisor to assure there are ratio’s and all children are safe.
* Maintains an on-going staff schedule and ensures replacement coverage as needed.
* Coordinates services with other agency departments.
* Maintains effective collegial relationships with Lead Case Manager, Medical, Unit Supervisors, Lead Clinician, Educational Coordinator and Supervisor of Transportation.
* Establishes and monitors compliance with federal, agency, departmental and unit policies, procedures and routines.
* Monitors that the individual and special needs of the children are met.
* Monitors and ensured provisions of a varied and appropriate recreational program.
* Demonstrates group management and crisis intervention skills.
* Monitors compliance with fire drill and fire alarm procedures.
* Coordinates to ensures appropriate educational programming.
* Appropriate coverage.
* Ensure and monitor Medical Assistant/Youth Specialist have a good work ethic.
* Any other related duties as required.

**About You:**

You are the ideal candidate if you are enjoy working in the social services field while empowering underserved communities. Being compassionate, reliable, self-motivated, and a team player are critical attributes to be successful in this role.

* You have a Minimum High School Diploma (BA preferred) + minimum of 3 years supervisory experience working with at risk youth or working with special needs population
* You are proficient in Spanish and English (required), both written and oral.
* You have a valid driver’s license.
* You have strong organizational and communication skills both written and oral.
* You have the ability to demonstrate counseling techniques and genuine sensitivity to children and families of diverse cultural backgrounds and with children with special needs.

**What We Offer:**

* Professional growth opportunities
* Medical, Dental, Prescription Drug and Vision Care benefits with premiums substantially paid by for employees, employee families and domestic partners
* Generous vacation, holiday, sick time and personal time off benefits
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Company paid life insurance and long-term Disability Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program

title: Sales Support
description:
Lincoln Tech in Mahwah, NJ is looking for an energetic, customer-centric Receptionist / Admin Assistant. In this position, you would support the Admissions Office's strategic goals, helping to administer the day-to-day workflow while also facilitating the admissions process.





**Requirements**


* High school diploma or GED
* Exceptional organizational skills
* Strong customer service and telephone skills
* A clear sense of urgency and ability to multitask
* Basic Microsoft Excel skills


**Responsibilities**


* Support Admissions initiatives by assisting students throughout the application process
* Respond to admissions-related inquiries from parents, high school personnel, campus partners, and internal staff
* Attend Admissions events
* Maintain admissions-related data and correspondence
* Provide overall support to the Admissions Department
* Report to the Director of Admissions
Requirements:
**Full-Time Benefits**
* Medical, Dental, Vision
* Life and Disability Insurance
* 401(k) with Company Match
* Paid Time Off and Holidays
* Growth Opportunities

For over 75 years Lincoln Tech has been one of the nation's leading providers of career training in Healthcare, Automotive/Diesel, Skilled Trades, Information Technology, Cosmetology, and Culinary Arts. We are an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.
**Learn More**

* Email: careers@lincolntech.edu
